contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=June 2008}} {{Infobox City Japan |Name= Nishigō |JapaneseName= 西郷村 |settlement_type= Village |MapImage= Nishigo in Fukushima Prefecture.png |Region= [[Tōhoku region|Tōhoku]] |Prefecture= [[Fukushima prefecture|Fukushima]] |District= [[Nishishirakawa District, Fukushima|Nishishirakawa]] |Area_km2= 192.32 |PopDate= 2003 |Population= 19,340 |Density_km2= auto |Coords= |LatitudeDegrees= 37 |LatitudeMinutes= 8 |LatitudeSeconds= 31 |LongtitudeDegrees= 140 |LongtitudeMinutes= 9 |LongtitudeSeconds= 19 |Tree= |Flower= |SymbolImage= |SymbolDescription= |Mayor= |CityHallPostalCode= |CityHallAddress= |CityHallPhone= |CityHallLink= [http://www.vill.nishigo.fukushima.jp/ Village of Nishigō] }} {{nihongo|'''Nishigō'''|西郷村|Nishigō-mura}} is a [[villages of Japan|village]] located in [[Nishishirakawa District, Fukushima|Nishishirakawa District]], [[Fukushima Prefecture|Fukushima]], [[Japan]]. As of 2003, the village has an estimated [[population]] of 19,340 and a [[population density|density]] of 100.56 persons per km². The total area is 192.32 km². Nishigo has three junior high schools: Nishigo First Jr. High School, Nishigo Second Jr. High School, and Kawatani Jr. High school as well as five elementary schools: Odakura Elementary School, Kumakura Elementary School, Yone Elementary School, Habuto Elementary School, and Kawatani Elementary School. Nishigo is also one of the smallest towns in Japan to have a [[Shinkansen]] (bullet train) station, located at Shin-Shirakawa (new Shirakawa) on the [[Tōhoku Shinkansen|Tōhoku branch]]. This train travels from Tokyo to Sendai with stops at: Tokyo, Ueno, Ōmiya, Oyama, Utsunomiya, Nasushiobara, Shin-Shirakawa, Kōriyama, Fukushima City, and Sendai. ==External links== {{Commons category-inline|Nishigo, Fukushima|Nishigō, Fukushima}} * [http://www.vill.nishigo.fukushima.jp/ Nishigō official website] {{ja icon}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Nishigo, Fukushima}} [[Category:Villages in Fukushima Prefecture]] {{Fukushima-geo-stub}}
